Column Comment.0: SPATIAL PARCEL PUBLIC LAND BLOCK LOCATION: an ennumerated list of theparcels included in the Public land block Survey system in Alberta Canada. Theseparcels may be referenced when describing the spatial extent of a business objectsuch as a landright, field or pool.
Column Comment.1: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.2: AREA ID: Unique identifier for any named area such as a country, province, projectarea, area of interest, offshore area, district etc.
Column Comment.3: AREA TYPE ID: Unique identifier for the type of area, such as country, state, AOI etc.
Column Comment.4: COORDINATE SYSTEM ID: unique identifier for the coordinate system.
Column Comment.5: DESCRIPTION: Describes areas which are only partially included in the land parcelsmallest unit described (such asLOT for the PBL survey system)
Column Comment.6: EFFECTIVE DATE: date when the land parcel became effective
Column Comment.7: EXPIRY DATE: the date on which this row of data is no longer in effect from abusiness perspective.
Column Comment.8: BUSINESS ASSOCIATE: Unique identifier for a business associate, such as aperson, company, regulatory agency, government or consortium.
Column Comment.9: PBL BLOCK: the name of the public land block. Blocks are contained in plans, andmay contain lots.
Column Comment.10: PBL LOT: the smallest unit of the public land block system. May be described interms of a polygon.
Column Comment.11: PBL PLAN: the name of the PBL plan. Public land block plans are contained insubdivisions, and contain blocks and lots.
Column Comment.12: PB: SUBDIVISION: the highest level of definition for the public land block system.
Column Comment.13: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.14: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.15: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.16: SPATIAL DESCRIPTION: The surface and sub-surface description of any object thatoccupies an area, such as a land right, field, facility or area of interest. The surfacedescription may be stated in terms of a legal survey system, metes and bounds orpolygon. The mineral zone description describes the minerals (substances) andsubsurface definition (zones/formations) that are included in the definition. For landrights, continuations may be described by generating a new Spatial description.NOTE: In this table, the FK is added to allow you to describe the polygonal outline fora parcel.
Column Comment.17: SPATIAL DESCRIPTION OBSERVATION NUMBER: a unique series number for thespatial description, allowing the spatial description to be versioned over time.
Column Comment.18: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.19: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.20: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.21: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.22: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.23: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.24: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
